thread.title: Hawkers peddling golgappas on pushcarts or portable wicker stands are
thread.title_full: Hawkers peddling golgappas on pushcarts or portable wicker stands are

author: Avijit Ghosh
title: Hawkers peddling golgappas on pushcarts or portable wicker stands are
text:
Hawkers peddling golgappas on pushcarts or portable wicker stands are one of the most familiar sights of small-town and urban India. The golgappas, filled with a slushy paste of potatoes and tangy tamarind water, are gulped down in one go. Tourists from abroad too can be seen relishing the spicy snack.
Golgappas have different names in different parts of the country. In Bilaspur, a not-so small town in Chhattisgarh, I came across a seller – I only remember his surname, Yadav ji – who had painted all its synonyms on his handcart.
Take a look. Enjoy.
